wikipedia_page.main: Shôn Dale-Jones is a Welsh writer and performer having created the popular character of 'Hugh Hughes'. He is also the artistic director of Hoipolloi.

response: The company was founded in 1994 by Shôn Dale-Jones (now Artistic Director) and Stefanie Müller (Associate Director).  Dale-Jones and Müller met at the International Theatre School Jacques Lecoq,http://www.watfordtheatre.co.uk/pl94cast.html and initially worked with other performers they had met at the school.  The Lecoq approach to theatre was a large influence on the company’s work. Since 1994, Hoipolloi have created and toured 18 new shows. The company was wound down in 2020 after 26 years.

All Hoipolloi productions were devised by the company's core artistic team, led by Artistic Director Shôn Dale-Jones, including input from the performers, with improvisation playing a large role in the creation of each show.FAQs : Hoipolloi Hoipolloi shows are often highly theatrical and humorous.  Shôn Dale-Jones’ interest in nonsense literature is reflected in Hoipolloi’s last two ensemble shows, The Doubtful Guest, inspired by the book of the same name by Edward Gorey, and My Uncle Arly, which was inspired by the work of Edward Lear .
